title: Factor out the greatest common term
text: What is the greatest common factor of all the terms in the expression $$6x^2-12x c+6b x-12b c$$?

title: Finding the GCF
text: What is the greatest common factor of $$6x^2$$, $$-\left(12x c\right)$$, $$6b x$$ and $$-\left(12b c\right)$$?

title: Group terms
text: Next, we will group the terms with similar factor together.

title: Group terms
text: In the expression, $$x^2-2x c+b x-2b c$$, we will group $$x^2$$ and -(2*x*c)) together

title: Factor by grouping
text: We will group $$b x$$ and $$-\left(2b c\right)$$ together, so we can factor out the common factor of b. $$b x-2b c=b \left(x-2c\right)$$

title: Finding the GCF
text: Based on the above steps, we yield $$x^2-2x c+b x-2b c=x \left(x-2c\right)+b \left(x-2c\right)$$. What is the greatest common factor of $$x \left(x-2c\right)$$ and $$b \left(x-2c\right)$$?

title: Finding Values
text: $$x \left(x-2c\right)$$ and $$b \left(x-2c\right)$$ has the greatest common factor (x-2c), so we can further factor $$x \left(x-2c\right)+b \left(x-2c\right)$$ into (x-2*c)*(?). what is (?)?

title: Put together all factors
text: Based on the above steps, we get $$6x^2-12x c+6b x-12b c=6\left(x^2-2x c+b x-2b c\right)=6\left(x+b\right) \left(x-2c\right)$$

title: Final remark
text: Alternatively, you can also group (x**2 with b*x), (-2*x*c with -2*b*c) then do factoring by grouping. You should yield the same final answer. You can try it as exercise.
